OPM Schedule F / Schedule Policy-Career Rule Reinstatement (Docket ID: OPM-2025-0004, RIN: 3206-AO80)

A proposed rule by the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) to reclassify certain federal positions as 'Schedule F' or 'Schedule Policy/Career,' making them at-will and subject to political appointment/removal, aiming to increase executive control and accountability by broadening hiring/firing discretion for policy-influencing roles.
1,000
Total Comments
0
With Attachments
925
Avg. Characters
2025-06-28

Opposition to Politicization of the Civil Service/Schedule F Opposition to Weakening Federal Due Process and Worker Protections (General Civil Service Rights)

Public servants should act in non partisan actions, which means their personal beliefs should not be punished or enforced. This would enforce loyalty to the current administration, which would cause inefficient, confusi... 1 1:1 None This would enforce loyalty to the current administration, which would cause inefficient, confusing service to the American people. The commenter expresses concern that the proposed changes would undermine the nonpartisan nature of public servants and create a system where loyalty to the administration takes precedence over effective service. This aligns with opposition to the politicization of the civil service and highlights risks to worker protections and due process.

OPM-2025-0004-8135 2025-06-28 None None

The commenter expresses support for President Trump's efforts to increase accountability within the federal bureaucracy and endorses the OPM rule as a means to reprimand underperforming employees, which aligns with the stances of supporting executive authority and improving workforce performance through easier removal. There are no fundamentally different positions presented.
